Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close from 2pm and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on roads approaching Moore Park including Anzac Pde, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd as large crowds travel to the SCG during the busy Friday evening peak.

Driver Ave will also be partially closed before, during and after the event.

Special event clearways will be in place on various roads around Moore Park from 12pm midday until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

From 8pm to 11pm Art Gallery Rd / Mrs Macquaries Rd will be closed.

A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers FC v Sydney FC at Bankwest Stadium from 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St

properties.headline: RunWest - Sunday 29 March - EASTERN CREEK TO ROOTY HILL VIA BLACKTOWN Great Western Hwy, Ferrers Rd, Eastern Rd, North Pde
properties.publicTransport: Free event shuttle buses will run from nearby stations. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 6,000 participants will take part in the 2nd year of the RunWest event consisting of a 12km and 4km fun run through some of Western Sydney’s popular landmarks from Eastern Creek and Blacktown to Rooty Hill.

The 12km course starts at 7am and travels from Sydney Motorsport Park, across the Great Western Hwy, through Sydney Zoo and Western Parklands to Blacktown International Sportspark finishing at West HQ in Rooty Hill. The 4km course starts at 10am and travels from Blacktown International Sportspark to West HQ via the M7 shared pathway. A finisher’s festival will be held at West HQ (former Rooty Hill RSL) until 12:30pm.

Road closures:

  • Rooty Hill - From 3am to 2pm: sections of North Pde, Rooty Hill Rd Nth and Sherbrooke St From 7am to 11.30am Eastern Rd between Knox Rd and Rooty Hill Rd South will be closed.
  • Eastern Creek / Huntingwood - From 6am to 9am: Brabham Dr between Ferrers Rd and Great Western Hwy, Ferrers Rd between Chandos Rd and Brabham Dr as well as sections of Huntingwood Dr, Peter Brock Dr, Rudders St and William Dean St.
  • Eastern Creek - From 6.45am to 8.30am: Great Western Hwy between the M7 Mwy and Doonside Rd. M7 off ramp to Great Western Hwy will be closed. 

Special event clearways will be in effect between 3am and 10am on roads along and surrounding the course including North Pde, Sherbrooke St, Rooty Hill Rd North, William Dean St, Huntingwood Dr, Rudders St and Doonside Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 6AM TO 9AM - EASTERN CREEK / HUNTINGWOOD

  • Brabham Drive between Great Western Highway and Ferrers Road
  • Ferrers Road 1 between Chandos Road and Brabham Drive
  • Huntingwood Drive between Liberty Road and William Dean St
  • Peter Brock Drive 2 between Gate B of Sydney Motorsport Park (Boori Australia) and Brabham Drive
  • Rudders Street between William Dean St and Great Western Highway
  • William Dean Street from Huntingwood Drive

Notes:

1 Access to Gate A for authorised vehicles only. Access to Gate D of Sydney Motorsport Park and Sydney International Dragway permitted for participant parking. No access to Brabham Drive.

2 Access maintained to Alpha Hotel Eastern Creek. Entry and exit from Hotel via Peter Brock Drive and Reservoir Rd only during closure times. 

FROM 6.45AM TO 8.30AM - EASTERN CREEK

  • Great Western Hwy 3 between Doonside Rd / Brabham Drive and M7 Motorway
  • Pikes Lane 4 at Great Western Highway

Notes:

3 Access from BagTrans maintained under direction of NSW Police and Authorised Traffic Controllers

4 Access maintained from Pikes Lane under direction of NSW Police and Authorised Traffic Controllers.   

FROM 6.45AM TO 9AM

  • Holbeche Rd west of Doonside Rd (westbound)

FROM 3AM TO 2PM - ROOTY HILL

  • North Parade 5 between Rooty Hill Rd Nth and Mount St
  • Rooty Hill Rd Nth 6 between North Parade and Pedestrian crossing
  • Sherbrooke Street between Railway St and North Parade

Notes:

5 Managed Access for West HQ at Mount St.

6 Managed Access for residents of Perkins St and Premier Lane entry and exit via Rooty Hill Rd Nth at North Parade.

FROM 7AM TO 11.30AM

  • Eastern Road between Knox Road and Rooty Hill Rd South

  • Rudders St between William Dean Street and Great Western Highway (both sides)
  • William Dean Street between Rudders St and Huntingwood Drive (both sides)

FROM 4AM TO 10AM - DOONSIDE

properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: ShowLink tickets include travel on public transport and extra trains and buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Royal Easter Show is expected to attract over 850,000 visitors to Sydney Olympic Park over 12 days from Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April this year.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct. Delays are expected particularly over the Easter long weekend from Friday 1 to Monday 13 when the Show is typically busiest.

Visitors driving to the event are urged to plan to arrive early and pre-book parking as car parks often reach capacity from the early morning.

Roads within the precinct will also be closed before, during and after the show including sections of Australia Ave, Dawn Fraser Ave and Olympic Boulevard.
properties.displayName: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.headline: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Sunday 29 March - TURRAMURRA, KUR-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK, ST IVES Bobbin Head Rd, Mona Vale Rd
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 riders will participate in the annual Bobbin Head Cycle Classic in one of 4 events including a 104km, 80km, 57km or 27km course travelling from Turramurra through Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park and return. Events start from 6.30am.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm including sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, Liberator General San Martin Drive, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah and St Ives.

Speed limit reductions will be in effect between 6:15am and 1:30pm along sections of Mona Vale Rd, West Head Rd, Bobbin Head Rd, McCarrs Creek Rd and Pacific Hwy.

Special event clearways will be in place along a section of the course in St Ives from 7am to 1:30pm on the eastern side of Mona Vale Rd from Property No.425 to Kitchener St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

ST IVES - FROM 7AM TO 1.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road between Property No.425 to Kitchener St (Eastern Side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
TURRAMURRA

FROM 5:00AM TO 3:00PM

  • Karuah Road between Eastern Road and Turramurra Avenue (both directions)
  • Turramurra Avenue between Brentwood Avenue and Karuah Road (northbound)  

FROM 8:00AM TO 1.45PM

  • Bobbin Head Road at the intersection of Burns Road (Northbound right turn lane)  

KU-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK

FROM 6:15AM TO 9:15AM

  • Bobbin Head Road* between the Park Gates at North Turramurra and the Park Gates at Mt Colah (northbound) * Detour via Mt Colah

FROM 7:30 AM TO 12:30PM

  • Liberator General San Martin Drive* between Cottage Point Road and West Head Road (northbound) * Access to Cottage Point unaffected 

TERREY HILLS

FROM 6.30AM TO 2.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road Left hand westbound lane at intersection of Myoora Rd/Forest way (Kerb Lane)

MOUNT COLAH

FROM 6:15AM TO 8:45AM

  • Old Pacific Highway approaching the intersection of Belmont Parade (kerb lanes in both directions)  

ST IVES

FROM 6:45AM TO 1:30PM

  • Warrimoo Avenue between Killeaton Street and Mungarra Avenue (northbound)

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

  • Woodbury Road between Mona Vale Road and Hume Avenue (eastbound)
  • Mona Vale Road approaching the intersection of Richmond Road (westbound kerb lane)
arrangementElements.title: Road and Lane Closures

arrangementElements.html:
The speed limit will be temporarily reduced for the safety of cyclists riding amongst vehicle traffic at the following locations and times. Speed limit reductions affects both directions unless stated otherwise.

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 90KM/H TO 60KM/H:

  • 7am to 10.45am - St Ives to Terrey Hills on the eastbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Wildflower Gardens and Myoora Road
  • 8am to 1.45pm - Terrey Hills to St Ives on the westbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Forest Way and the Wildflower Gardens      

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 80KM/H TO 60KM/H:

7am to 12pm - Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park

  • West Head Road eastbound between Liberator General San Martin Drive and West Head Picnic Area
  • West Head Road westbound between West Head Picnic Area and Liberator General San Martin Drive

6.30am to 8.30am - Mount Colah eastbound lanes of Bobbin Head Road from the Park Gates to Kalkari Visitor Centre

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 60KM/H TO 40KM/H:

  • 6.15am to 8.45am - Mount Colah, both directions on the Pacific Highway between Pacific Highway and Belmont Parade
  • 7.30am to 10.45am - Terrey Hills in both directions on McCarr’s Creek Road between West Head Road and Liberator General San Martin Drive
arrangementElements.title: Speed Limit Reductions

properties.headline: Special event - Friday 6 to Sunday 8 March - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd, Chatham Rd approaching Newcastle Showground
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Newcastle Show at Newcastle Showground in Broadmeadow from 8:30am to 5pm on today. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd.

As crowds travel to and from the show over the weekend motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
properties.displayName: Special event - Friday 6 to Sunday 8 March

roads.mainStreet: Griffiths Rd, Chatham Rd

properties.headline: Procession - Sunday 8 March - HAYMARKET TO SYDNEY CBD Hay St and Elizabeth St
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting and may experience short term delays. Dulwich Hill Light rail services will be held as the march crosses the tracks at Hay St. Visit transportnsw.info for service alerts.
properties.otherAdvice:
Participants will gather at Belmore Park from 4pm and take to the road at 4.30pm travelling to Martin Place.

Rolling road closures will be in place between 4.15pm and 5.15pm on sections Hay St between Castlereagh St and Elizabeth St and the northbound lanes of Elizabeth St from Hay St to Martin Place.

Roads will progressively reopen as the group travels along the route under NSW Police escort.

roads.mainStreet: Hay St and Elizabeth St

properties.headline: Cycle ride - Friday 6 to Sunday 8 March - CANBERRA TO DUBBO via Hume Hwy, Mid Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 100 cyclists will be taking part in the 'Zoo 2 Zoo' ride from Lady Denman Dr in Canberra to Obley Rd in Dubbo between Friday 6 and Sunday 8 March.

The riders will share the road with motorists during the event and motorists are advised to exercise caution and remember when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Motorists should allow additional travel time when travelling along the cyclists routes.

On Sunday, cyclists will travel from Molong to Dubbo between 7am and 12:45pm via Mitchell Hwy, Banjo Patterson Way and Obley Rd.
properties.displayName: Cycle ride - Friday 6 to Sunday 8 March

roads.mainStreet: via Hume Hwy, Mid Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy

properties.headline: Cycle ride - Sunday 8 to Tuesday 10 March - BATHURST TO SYDNEY CBD via Great Western Hwy, Hawkesbury Rd, Springwood Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 170 cyclists will be taking part in the Tour De Cure Bathurst to Sydney ride over 3 days from Sunday 8 to Tuesday 10 March.

Closures will not be in place but riders will share the road with motorists during the event. Motorists are advised to exercise caution and remember when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

  • Day 1 Sunday - 8am to 4.30pm Bathurst to Trunkey Creek returning via Rockley and The Lagoon. Some delays are expected along Vale Rd, Trunkey Rd and Goulburn Rd.
  • Day 2 Monday - 8am to 4.30pm Mount Panorama Bathurst to Lithgow/Mt Victoria via Oberon, Rydal and Lithgow. Some delays are expected along Great Western Hwy (Bathurst), O’Connell Rd, Duckmaloi Rd and Great Western Hwy (Lithgow to Mount Victoria).
  • Day 3 Tuesday – 8am to 4.30pm Katoomba to Barangaroo (Sydney CBD) via Springwood and Richmond. Some delays are expected along Great Western Hwy (Katoomba to Springwood), Hawksbury Rd and Springwood Rd.

roads.mainStreet: via Great Western Hwy, Hawkesbury Rd, Springwood Rd

properties.headline: Parramasala festival - Friday 13 to Sunday 15 March - PARRAMATTA George St, Church St, Phillip St, Macquarie St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.adviceB: Use an alternative route; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place from Friday 13 until Sunday 15 March in Parramatta CBD for the 3-day Parramasala festival in Prince Alfred Park.

The opening night street parade on Friday starts from 7pm from Centenary Square to Prince Alfred Square travelling along Church St from Macquarie St to Market St which is already closed to traffic. Sections of Macquarie, George and Phillip Streets approaching Church St will be closed for up to 30 minutes while the parade is underway.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta CBD during the festival particularly on the Friday night during the already busy evening peak so allow additional travel time.

Road closures:

  • Friday 13 March - from 7pm to 7:30pm: Phillip Street between Marist St and Erby Place, George St between Marist St and Horwood Place, Macquarie St between Marist St and Horwood Place
  • From 5pm, Friday 13 March until 11pm, Sunday 15 March: Market St between Marist St and Palmer St, Church St between Palmer St and Victoria St.

Traffic changes for Parramatta Light Rail construction may affect how you travel through Parramatta CBD so exercise caution ad follow directional signage.
properties.displayName: Parramasala festival - Friday 13 to Sunday 15 March

roads.mainStreet: George St, Church St, Phillip St, Macquarie St

webLinks.linkText: St Patrick's Day Festival - site map

properties.headline: St Patrick's Day Festival - Sunday 15 March - THE ROCKS George St, Hickson Rd between Essex St AND the Overseas Passenger Terminal
properties.publicTransport: Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport with Circular Quay within short walking distance. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Local road closures will be in place in The Rocks area as large crowds celebrate St Patrick’s Day. A festival will be held in First Fleet Park from 11.30am to 5.30pm. A parade will kick off the celebrations at 11am starting from Hickson Rd at George St travelling south on George St to First Fleet Park by 12pm midday.

Roads will be closed from 10am to 1pm including George St from Essex St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd at the Overseas Passenger Terminal and Circular Quay West. 

Note the standard weekend closure of George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St will remain in place until midnight on Wednesday 18 March.

Motorists should allow extra travel time through the area and exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on local roads throughout the day.

arrangementElements.html:
THE ROCKS

FROM 4AM SATURDAY 14 MARCH TO 12AM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY 18 MARCH

  • George St 1 between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St

Notes: 1 Standard road closure in place for The Rocks Markets, extended for post-event operations. Road Closure in place from Monday till Wednesday for St Patricks Day Breakfast.

FROM 10AM TO 1PM - SUNDAY 15 MARCH

  • George St 2 between Essex St and Hickson Rd
  • Hickson Rd between Overseas Passenger Terminal upper roadway driveway and George St
  • Circular Quay West between George St and the end of the street

Notes: 2 Managed access will be provided for the Four Seasons Hotel (No Access once the parade commences).

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 15 March - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Wests Tigers from 6:15pm at WIN Stadium. Prelim game from 3.45pm.

With large crowds expected traffic will be heavy on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game.

Roads around the stadium will close from 2:30pm until 8.30pm including Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St.

Motorists should expect delays and follow directions from traffic controllers on site.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street and Burelli street

properties.headline: March - Saturday 7 March - SYDNEY CBD TO HAYMARKET from Hyde Park North via Market St, Castlereagh St to Belmore Park
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting and may experience short term delays. Dulwich Hill Light rail services will be held as the march crosses the tracks at Hay St. Visit transportnsw.info for service alerts.
properties.otherAdvice:
The March started from Hyde Park North from to Belmore Park. 

Rolling road closures will be in place between 11.15am and 12.30pm on Market St between Elizabeth and Castlereagh Streets and Castlereagh St from Market St to Hay St.

Roads will progressively reopen behind the group travels along the route under NSW Police escort.

roads.mainStreet: from Hyde Park North via Market St, Castlereagh St

properties.headline: Festival - Saturday 7 March - CAMPERDOWN Parramatta Rd approaching Victoria Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Days Like This Festival at Victoria Park from 12pm until 10pm. 

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area and exercise caution. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the park including Parramatta Rd, City Rd and Broadway.

roads.mainStreet: Parramatta Rd

properties.headline: Concert & Music Festival - Saturday 7 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Elton John concert tickets include travel on public transport. Ultra Music Festival tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
Around 40,000 people will attend events at venues in Parramatta including Elton John in concert at Bankwest Stadium with gates open from 5pm and Ultra Music Festival at neighbouring Parramatta Park from 1pm until 11pm. 

Delays are expected along O'Connell St, George St, Church St, Victoria Rd, Parramatta Rd and Pennant Hills Rd approaching Parramatta and along Hawkesbury Rd and Park Ave around Westmead Station as crowds arrive at both venues throughout the afternoon.

Traffic will be particularly heavy in the evening from 10.30pm as both events finish around the same time and road closures will be in place.

Roads around Bankwest Stadium will close prior to the end of the concert and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists can detour around the closures in Parramatta via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd.

Roads around Westmead Station will also be busy as festival goers leave the park so motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street
